info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 18 at 5:35PM MDT until May 18 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
At 535 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicates the heavy rainfall has ended over the warned area with between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain having fallen over portions of the Remington and McGhee burn areas. While the heavy rainfall has ended, flash flooding is likely ongoing and it will take several hours for water to recede.
HAZARD...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by thunderstorms in and around the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and downstream of the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Birney, Birney Village and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation.
Streams impacted by flash flooding include Hanging Woman Creek, Lee Creek, and the East Fork of Hanging Woman Creek.
info.instruction:
This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE NORTHERN REMINGTON AND MCGHEE BURN AREAS REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN ROSEBUD COUNTY
